newsitem.title: CHINA: HK police arrest 153 in illegal immigrant sweep.
newsitem.headline: HK police arrest 153 in illegal immigrant sweep.

text.p: Hong Kong police arrested 153 people on Thursday in a sweeping land and sea crackdown on illegal immigrants in the former British colony.
The sweep, the first since the territory became a special Chinese region on July 1, began late on Wednesday and was completed just before dawn on Thursday.
Police said they stopped more than 13,500 people for questioning and arrested 153 persons.
Officers swooped on 15 building sites, a favourite place for illegals to hide out and work, and stopped thousands of cars, trucks and ships for inspection.
A spokesman said all illegal immigrants caught would be promptly repatriated and their abettors would be prosecuted.
Most illegals caught in Hong Kong come from the Chinese interior, with which Hong Kong maintains a tightly controlled border.

Hong Kong is a part of China but is a separate, highly autonomous capitalist region. Many people in Hong Kong are concerned that the region's return to China could lead to an influx of illegal immigrants.
